head.title: U.S. Women Squeak By In Bridge

hedline.hl1: U.S. Women Squeak By In Bridge

block.p: Both United States bridge teams were in action here today at the World Bridge Championship, although one of them came within a hair of being eliminated on Sunday night.

The American open team, playing against Argentina on Sunday, won convincingly by 76 imps. Today it faced Austria in the quarterfinal and led by 46 after 48 deals of a scheduled 80. The Austrians appeared to have been defeated in the previous round, but an appeal reversed the result, giving them a victory by 4 against Sweden.

The American open team, playing against Argentina on Sunday, won convincingly by 76 imps. Today it faced Austria in the quarterfinal and led by 46 after 48 deals of a scheduled 80. The Austrians appeared to have been defeated in the previous round, but an appeal reversed the result, giving them a victory by 4 against Sweden.

The United States women's team won Sunday night by 7 imps against Scotland in a match that was close throughout. Today the Americans faced a Dutch team (which has the Venice Cup world title) and led by 5 with 32 deals remaining. The Dutch had also had a narrow escape, winning their previous match by 6 against Israel.

Two other teams in the open series survived narrowly Sunday night. England trailed Belgium by 38 going into the final 16-deal quarter, but a stretch drive gave them a victory by 5. Today the English took a lead of 17 against Norway, which had beaten Russia by 14. Brazil beat Indonesia by 5, but trailed today by 28 against Italy. The favored Italian squad had won by 80 Sunday night against Australia.
Iceland, which had beaten the Netherlands by 13 last night, started badly today. It trailed by 28 against Poland, which had beaten France by 23.
